title: Inside the Thompson on Miami Beach where Miley Cyrus loves to party
text:
View
comments
The Thompson on Miami Beach has a strong celebrity following, even having played host to party-girl Miley Cyrus.
The ocean-front hotel aims to create a fusion of international appeal and local Miami ethos.
Interior designer Martin Brudnizki has created a bohemian-beach chic hotel that seeks to exude the glamour of 1950s Miami Beach, housed in a 1940s Art Deco venue.
The oceanfront Thompson on Miami Beach aims to create a fusion of international appeal and local Miami concept.
Pop star Miley Cyrus, Beyoncé’s sister Solange Knowles and Padma Lakshmi have visited the boutique hotel
Star quality : Pop star Miley Cyrus, Beyoncé’s sister Solange Knowles, Padma Lakshmi.
Vital statistics : This hotel splashed out on a colour-laden take on the 1950s when it opened last November. Three separate towers house 380 rooms and suites, two swimming pools and a rooftop spa.
The 1930s House, taking pride of place at the centre of the hotel, is a bungalow that serves as a cocktail bar. It’s witty and warm, unlike many other Miami drinking holes.
Meanwhile, foodies can head to Seagrape, award-winning chef Michelle Bernstein’s restaurant – the dinner menu includes succulent steaks, lobster ravioli, and fresh Florida snapper.
Location report : In the heart of an area known as Mid-Beach, the large number of cranes and construction workers visible does hint that this is an emerging area.
Mid-Beach is a short taxi ride or a 20-minute walk from the more famous South Beach. A gate from the pool complex takes you straight out on to the boardwalk and the beach.
Key attraction : You’ll find Florida charm turned up to the max. In contrast to South Beach’s hipper hotels with their whiter shades of pale, Thompson is awash in rich blues and yellows, patterns and stripes.
You’d never make it work in your own semi, but here it’s pulled off triumphantly, especially in the bedrooms and the garden area.
Throw in a rooftop spa and a branch of cult hairdresser Hatter & Junior and it becomes holiday heaven.
In the news: New hotels in Miami make their mark with parties – and Thompson has poured time and energy into its events. Miley Cyrus was in situ last December during Art Basel – Miami’s celebrity-laden art event.
In February, Solange Knowles and Salman Rushdie’s ex Padma Lakshmi headed to the Veuve Clicquot party at the hotel to celebrate Mardi Gras with samba dancers.

A meal at Seagrape comes in at about $100 a head, excluding drinks, while a few rounds of cocktails at the 1930s House will set you back a further $50 a head. Rooms start at $179 (about £115) a night. Visit thompsonmiamibeach.com.
